优秀，真正的神作，剧情反转无敌！什么时候出三啊！

[h1]Have Your Cake and Eat It Too[/h1]
Wow! It's finally taken me this long to properly sit down and play through this game. Or should I see this experience, as to be honest it's not a very long game at all. I took my time, tried to accomplish some achievements along the way through the story and it still took me about 3 hours in total. But boy are those 3 hours absolutely worth it! Mind you, I'm not particularly fond of puzzle games at all but this hit just the right spot in being relatively challenging enough to get through levels with some thought whilst still enjoying the story, but also never becoming frustrating at all. It all progresses very smoothly and in typical Valve fashion, intricately designed and the narrative is written to perfection. 

The Portal Gun is an icon of the gaming industry at this point so there's not much to explain on the game play. Just know that it's best to just go in here as blind as possible if you're a newcomer and just enjoy this artful experience. 

You'll be GLaD to have done so ;)

This game is great!

It's great the first time around, anyway. This game has minimal replay value in my eyes. Portal goes for a creepy, sterile atmosphere which makes the player isolated. That atmosphere works great in tandem with GLaDOS, the monotone AI that watches you throughout the whole game (I would talk more about her, but I fear spoiling something). The issue is that on a second playthrough, you'll probably have at least vague memories of the puzzles and that atmosphere just feels a bit bland. The only two reasons I'd see for launching this games is that you've either not played it in forever or want to 100% the game (please don't do that to yourself, all the bonus levels suck). It doesn't help with how short the game is. I was able to beat it in approximately an hour and a half. Honestly, Portal 2 is a much better pick. It's longer, its characters are much more entertaining and its puzzles feel much more unique.

Another problem is that this game gives me motion sickness. Normally I have no problems with it, but for some reason this game makes me nauseous as hell.

I know this review seems really negative, but don't get me wrong. That first playthrough was really was great. Also, this game usually goes on sale for like 80% off, so you can get it for only a couple bucks.

Final Verdict: Portal is good, but not $10 good
[i] Edit: Added the bit about motion sickness [/i]

This game is awesome! The pacing is perfect, the puzzles are fun, and the game always throws new things at you to solve. It is perfectly bite-sized, and can easily be completed in just a few hours. I think the short length is one of the game's biggest strengths; it is easy to get into for people unfamiliar with FPS games, and it is very re-playable. 
This competes with [strike] Half Life 1 [/strike]  Deus Ex for my favourite FPS of all time.

Good game and here is a :

Simple Carrot Cake                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        INGREDIENTS:
Olive oil, to grease
1/2 cup (80g) brown sugar
3/4 cup (185ml) olive oil
1/2 cup (125ml) golden syrup
3 eggs
1 tsp vanilla essence
1 cup (150g) self-raising flour
1/2 cup (75g) plain flour
1 tsp Coles Bicarbonate Soda
1/2 tsp Coles Cinnamon Ground
2 (about 300g) carrots, peeled and grated

METHOD:
Step 1
Preheat oven to 170C or 150C fan-forced. Grease a 20cm (base) round cake pan lightly with oil
and line with non-stick baking paper.
Step 2
Put the brown sugar, oil, golden syrup, eggs and vanilla in a separate bowl. Use a balloon whisk to mix until combined.
Step 3
Sift the flours, bicarbonate of soda and cinnamon into a large bowl.
Step 4
Pour the oil mixture into the dry ingredients. Use a wooden spoon to stir gently until just combined. Stir in the grated carrot.
Step 5
Pour the mixture into the pan and bake for 1 hour. Set aside for 5 minutes, before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely
